Author: cipi#4502
Content:
```{
    "name": "kmd",
    "symbol": "kmd",
    "algorithm": "equihash",
    "txfee": 0.00005,
    "sapling": true
}```
is my kmd.json... i guess you forgot to set `"sapling": true`

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: here Anyone running a minining pool for KMD or any assetchains and you don't have a `Pool-Operator` role assigned, please let me know by posting here or by DM'ing me with your pool URL. I'll assign you role and will add your KMD pool in the pinned list on this channel. Existing @Pool-Operator can  change your nickname with your pool name if you like. And, please keep an eye here for important announcements and updates that you might have to do during the next month or so.

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: What'd you have to do to it?

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: Also why is it hard coded to reject absurd fees? To protect people from fucking it away with fat fingers?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @NutellaLicka it's meant to protect average users from paying fees larger than the amount they are sending

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @NutellaLicka z_sendmany also has similar code

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I can see it's value to attempt to prevent users from making xtns

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: But once it's in the mempool, the code seems misguided. Of course mining pools are going to comment that shit out

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I feel that it should be a CLI option, so KMD pools don't have to patch their code

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: It protects average users through stopping other nodes accepting your transaction?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: If I were a pool op, I would run the code that makes me the most money

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @NutellaLicka if everybody followed the rule, yes. But obviously, that is not going to happen

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: It only takes one person to comment it out, then everybody else is incentivized to do the same

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @NutellaLicka some RPC's prevent transactions from ever getting to the mempool, because fee > amount. I think that is reasonable

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: Yeah that is

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: If you want something like that, make a raw transaction
